Class PokemonManager

java.lang.Object
org.pokemondatabase.PokemonManager
public class PokemonManager extends Object

PURPOSE/PRIMARY FUNCTION

Used for all the methods that interact with the Pokémon Class. Uses the userInputHelper class to loop until the user gives a valid input. Uses Text class to color the output to look nicer in the CLI

IMPORTANT DEPENDENCIES

  • UserInputHelper: Called throughout to get user information for the CLI

Includes methods that allow the user to:

  • Add a Pokémon using the CMI
  • Uses methods in this class that add each item before using them to create new Pokémon and add it to the Pokémon Storage.
  • Add a Pokémon using a txt file.
  • Remove a Pokémon using a Pokédex Number.
  • Find a Pokémon using a Pokédex Number.
  • Get all Pokémon and prints them to the CMI.
  • Update a Pokémon using a Pokédex Number.
  • Compare the weight and height of 2 Pokémon
  • Check when a specified Pokémon will evolve.

  • Method Details

    • addPokemon

      public String addPokemon(List<Pokemon> pokemonStorage, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Lets the user add a Pokémon using the CMI. Calls other methods in this class to obtain all Pokémon information using the CLI.
      Parameters:
      pokemonStorage - List of Pokémon
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      String Success or Failure results

    • addPokemonName

      public String addPokemonName()
      Calls the userInputHelper method to ask the user to enter a Pokémon Name.
      Returns:
      String the Pokémon

    • formatPokemonName

      public String formatPokemonName(String pokemonName)
      Formats the Pokémon’s name to have first letter of each word capital and the rest are lowercase.
      Parameters:
      pokemonName - String of the Pokémon’s name
      Returns:
      Formatted String of the Pokémon’s name

    • addPokedexNumber

      public int addPokedexNumber(MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Calls the userInputHelper method getIntInRange with the parameters 1 and 1164 to get the new Pokédex numbr with specified parameters.
      Parameters:
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      int of Pokédex Number

    • validateUniquePokedexNumber

      public ValidationResults validateUniquePokedexNumber(int pokedexNumber, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Checks through the list of Pokémon to verify the provided Pokédex Number does not match a Pokédex number already in the system.
      Parameters:
      pokedexNumber - int Pokédex Number
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      ValidationResults containing a boolean whether it passed, and a String of the results

    • addPokemonTypes

      public PokemonTypesManager addPokemonTypes()
      Calls the userInputHelper method getValidType for the primary type and a secondary type if the user chooses to add one.
      Returns:
      PokémonTypesManager containing the Primary and possibly Secondary Types.

    • addEvolutionLevel

      public int addEvolutionLevel()
      Calls the userInputHelper method getBooleanInput to check if the Pokémon has a next evolution and then uses the getIntInRange method to get a valid Pokémon Level.
      Returns:
      Int of the Next Evolution Level

    • addPokemonWeightOrHeight

      public BigDecimal addPokemonWeightOrHeight(String weightOrHeight)
      Uses the userInputHelper method getBigDecimal to get either the height or weight
      Parameters:
      weightOrHeight - String containing the Weight or Height
      Returns:
      BigDecimal of either the weight or height of a Pokémon

    • hasPokemonBeenCaught

      public boolean hasPokemonBeenCaught()
      Calls userInputHelper method getBooleanInput to get true or false from the user.
      Returns:
      Boolean of if the Pokémon has been caught or not.

    • addPokedexEntry

      public String addPokedexEntry()
      Calls userInputHelper method getBooleanInput to ask the user if they want to add a Pokédex Entry and then the getString method to get the Pokédex Entry.
      Returns:
      String of the Pokédex Entry (can be null)

    • addPokemonFromFileGUI

      public ValidationResults addPokemonFromFileGUI(String fileLocation, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Allows the user to specify a file location and add all Pokémon in that file to the system. Then looks through the lines calling the getPokémon Method
      Parameters:
      fileLocation - String of the File Path
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      Validation Results (boolean, String)

    • getPokemonForGUI

      public ValidationResults getPokemonForGUI(String[] variables, int lineCounter, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Called by addPokémonFromFile method. Used to take a String list and split it into the specified variables and create a new Pokémon with it.
      Parameters:
      variables - A List of Strings from each line of the text document
      lineCounter - the counter used to check what current line the system is on
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      ValidationResults(Boolean, String)

    • addPokemonFromFile

      public String addPokemonFromFile(List<Pokemon> pokemonStorage, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Allows the user to specify a file location and add all Pokémon in that file to the system. Then looks through the lines calling the getPokémon Method
      Parameters:
      pokemonStorage - The List that holds all Pokémon
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      String of the error message or the success message

    • getPokemon

      public Pokemon getPokemon(String[] variables, int lineCounter, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Called by addPokémonFromFile method. Used to take a String list and split it into the specified variables and create a new Pokémon with it.
      Parameters:
      variables - A List of Strings from each line of the text document
      lineCounter - The counter used to check what current line the system is on
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      A new Pokémon

    • updatePokemonInformation

      public String updatePokemonInformation(List<Pokemon> pokemonStorage, MainMenuPage mainApp)
      Used to accept a Pokédex Number to specify a Pokémon to change specified piece of information. Then uses a switch to update a single piece of information.
      Parameters:
      pokemonStorage - List of Pokémon
      mainApp - MainMenuPage Gui main menu
      Returns:
      String of the results
